text.0: we call on thee o matchless one we seeking help possessing nothing firm ourselves.
text.1: call on thee wonderful in fight.
text.2: on thee for aid in sacrifice this youth of ours the bold the mighty hath gonse forth.
text.3: we therefore we thy friends indra havie chosen thee freegiver as our guardian god.
text.4: come hither for the drops are here o lord of cornlands lord of horses lord of kine.
text.5: drink thou the soma somas lord.
text.6: for we the kinless singers have drawn hither thee o indra who hast numerous kin.
text.7: with all the forms thou hast comic thou of bulllike strength come near to drink the soma juice.
text.8: sitting like birds beside thy meath mingled with milk that gladdeneth and exalteth thee.
text.9: indra to thee we sing aloud.
text.10: we speak to thee with this our reverential prayer why art thou pondering yet awhile.
text.11: here are our wishes thou art liberal lord of bays we and our hymns are present here.
text.12: for not in recent times alone o indra thunderarmed have we obtained thine aid.
text.13: of old we knew thy plenteous wealth.
text.14: hero we knew thy friendship and thy rich rewards these thunderer now we crave of thee.
text.15: o vasu for all wealth that cometh of the kine sharpen our powers fairvisored god.
text.16: him who of old hath brought to us this and that blessing him i magnify for you.
text.17: even indra o my friends for help.
text.18: borne by bay steeds the lord of heroes ruling men for it is he who takes delight.
text.19: may maghavan bestow on us his worshippers hundreds of cattle and of steeds.
text.20: hero may we with thee for friend withstand the man who pants against us in his wrath.
text.21: in fight with people rich in kine.
text.22: may we be victors in the singers battlesong and meet the wicked much invoked.
text.23: with heroes smite the foeman and show forth our strength o indra further thou our thoughts.
text.24: o indra from all ancient time rivalless ever and companionless art thou.
text.26: thou findest not the wealthy man to be thy friend those scorn thee who are flown with wine.
text.27: what time thou thunderest and gatherest then thou even as a father art invoked.
text.28: o indra let us not like fools who waste their lives at home with friendship such as thine.
text.29: sit idly by the pouredout juice.
text.30: giver of kine may we not miss thy gracious gifts let us not rob thee of thine own.
text.31: strip even the strong places of the foe and bring thy gifts can never be made vain.
text.32: indra or blest sarasvatī alone bestows such wealth treasure so great or thou.
text.34: citra is king and only kinglings are the rest who dwell beside sarasvatī.
text.35: he like parjanya with his rain hath spread himself with thousand yea with myriad gifts.
